main event: In Madison, Wisconsin on August 15, 1953, civilians observed an unidentified object moving in the sky for approximately 5 minutes before disappearing at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: The object appeared to change color from reddish to orange and then back to reddish.
The object seemed to move downwards, upwards, and then directly in front of the observers' car before moving away at a high rate of speed.
It is estimated that the object was at an altitude of 5,000 to 8,000 feet and had a sharp, definite outline.
The object appeared to have no trail or exhaust effect.
At the time of the first sighting until it disappeared, the object was constantly under observation by the witnesses.
